Body: Remember that the intersection of the outputs of two context-free languages is not necessarily context free. So (a raised to power x) (b ... x) (c ... y) intersected with (a ... z) (b ... x) (c ... x) produces (a ... x) (b ... x) (c ... x) because of the identity relation of the two b expressions, a result that is context-sensitive. (Sorry I can't write it in standard mathematical notation.)
